christmas_tree.description: The house is treed.  Felix pretends to be Papa Noel; the bells are to keep airplanes (Dean) from crashing into him.
christmas_tree.title: Christmas Tree

cuddle1.description: Nana flew in for Felix's birthday and a cuddle.
cuddle1.title: Cuddle 1

felix_bday01.description: Felix knows what's right, and what's right on his birthday is baking a CHOCOLATE CAKE!
felix_bday01.title: Felix Bday 1

felix_bday03.description: Our chocolate cakes undergo the most stringent quality control procedures.
felix_bday03.title: Felix Bday 3

felix_bday04.description: Felix, chief mixologist and quality control officer.
felix_bday04.title: Felix Bday 4

felix_bday05.description: One day the boys didn't wake up until 8 am. In those few stupendous undistracted minutes with which she was gifted, Lucie had the idea to do a puppet show at Felix's birthday party. Here, the stage hands prepare the props.
felix_bday05.title: Felix Bday 5

felix_bday06.description: A hushed silence falls.  The puppet show, called "What Santa Needs", is about to commence.
felix_bday06.title: Felix Bday 6

felix_bday07.description: It's about a little girl named Martine, who on Christmas eve sets out everything that Santa might need:  milk, cookies, and a little book to read while he eats.
felix_bday07.title: Felix Bday 7

felix_bday08.description:
Santa (played by Nounours) flies in on a reindeer. He eats the food and discovers he needs to pee! He wakes up Martine and asks her where can he pee. She gets out a potty, he pees, washes his hands, and wishes everybody a merry Christmas. And next year, please leave a potty out with the milk and cookies!

The crowd went wild.
felix_bday08.title: Felix Bday 8

felix_bday09.description: Felix spent the entire play behind the scenes with mom and dad.   When the play was over, there was a meltdown:  he wanted to be Santa in the play!   His acting aspirations crushed at such a tender age, there was only one recourse:  light the candles on the birthday cake.
felix_bday09.title: Felix Bday 9

felix_bday10.description: The kids demolish the cake. Little Max screamed in anguish and ecstasy: "More! More!" You can see lots more pictures of the people at the party here.
felix_bday10.title: Felix Bday 10

santa01.description: We went to Children's Fairyland in Oakland to visit Santa.  The train ride wasn't strictly necessary to get to Santa, but it helped.
santa01.title: Santa 1

santa02.description: The boat ride wasn't strictly necessary, either.
santa02.title: Santa 2

santa03.description: Felix spotted Santa strolling to his workshop and was drawn like a moth to a flame.
santa03.title: Santa 3

santa04.description: Fearless, he told Santa his name and that he wanted a rocket ship.
santa04.title: Santa 4

santa05.description: Milo asked for a 20-pack of bibs.
santa05.title: Santa 5

sorta_eating1.description: Milo has been almost unmanageable at supper because he's wanted food so badly.
sorta_eating1.title: Sorta Eating 1

sorta_eating2.description: So, on Felix's birthday, he got his first solid food. If you're a glutton for gluttony, here's more pictures of Milo's first meal.
sorta_eating2.title: Sorta Eating 2

sorta_standing1.description: Milo's been sorta standing a lot.  Though we can't imagine him actually walking for months and months.
sorta_standing1.title: Sorta Standing 1

sorta_standing2.description: Felix got this activity saucer as a hand-me-down from a friend.  We then gave it to someone else.  Now it's back for Milo.  It's like the Christmas fruitcake that won't die.
sorta_standing2.title: Sorta Standing 2

description:
Felix is now a three year old! By our recollection, just a few days ago he was a helpless lump. Now he's a fine upstanding boy -- happy, polite -- with a vivid imagination and a love of books. He's living a thoughtful life: lots of empathy for others, thinking a lot about friendship and what it means to have and keep friends, and always wondering about how others view the world. One of his favorite mechanisms to explore the motives of others is to ask Dean or Lucie what a person or animal or a character in a book is saying, even if they aren't saying anything. For example, when we're pretend fishing, he'll ask, "What fish in bucket say?" to explore whether the fish likes being in the bucket or not. Our answers are either honest or funny or both: "Ooo! Let me out of this bucket! I want to go swim! I don't want to be eaten!"

We couldn't be happier with the way he's turning out.

Milo, cute as he is, is still a helpless lump. On Felix's birthday, we gave Milo the gift of solid food.
title: December 12
